fermentables.name: Amber Dry Extract
fermentables.notes: Amber colored dry malt extract, for general purpose use. Use in any medium to dark colored beer. Examples: Ales, Marzens, Amber Ale, India Pale Ale

fermentables.name: Amber Liquid Extract
fermentables.notes: Unhopped amber color liquid extract. Use as a base malt for any Ale. Examples: Amber ale, India Pale Ale, Munich style, Marzen, Bock

fermentables.name: Barley Hulls
fermentables.notes: Hulls are introduced to improve the speed of lautering when making high gravity or high adjunct beers. Hulls are neutral in flavor, body and color, and are inert. Good for wheat beers, Wits, and others that have high protein mashes.

fermentables.name: Barley, Torrefied
fermentables.notes: Raw barley that has been popped open to open kernels. Used in place of raw barley for faster conversion and higher yields. High in haze producing protein

fermentables.name: Black (Patent) Malt
fermentables.notes: Dark color and dry roasted flavor characteristic of Stouts and Porters. Use for: Coloring in small amounts, or flavoring of Stouts and Porters in larger amounts.

fermentables.name: Black Barley (Stout)
fermentables.notes: Unmalted barley roasted at high temperature to create a dry, coffee like flavor. Imparts a sharp acrid flavor characteristic of dry stouts. Gives dryness to a stout or porter -- much more so than regular Roasted Barley

fermentables.name: Brown Sugar, Dark
fermentables.notes: Imparts a rich sweet flavor. Used in Scottish ales, holiday ales and some old ales.

fermentables.name: Brown Sugar, Light
fermentables.notes: Imparts a rich sweet flavor. Used in Scottish ales, holiday ales and some old ales.

fermentables.name: Candi Sugar, Amber
fermentables.notes: Crystalized Candi Sugar (Sucrose) used in many Belgian Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales. Adds head retention and sweet aroma to beer. Darker variants also add color.

fermentables.name: Candi Sugar, Clear
fermentables.notes: Crystalized Candi Sugar (Sucrose) used in many Belgian Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales. Adds head retention and sweet aroma to beer. Darker variants also add color.

fermentables.name: Candi Sugar, Dark
fermentables.notes: Crystalized Candi Sugar (Sucrose) used in many Belgian Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales. Adds head retention and sweet aroma to beer. Darker variants also add color.

fermentables.name: Cane (Beet) Sugar
fermentables.notes: Common household baking sugar. Lightens flavor and body of beer. Can contribute a cider-like flavor to the beer if not cold-fermented or used in large quantities.

fermentables.name: Cara-Pils/Dextrine
fermentables.notes: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer. Also sold under the names Dextrine and Cara-Foam

fermentables.name: Caraamber
fermentables.notes: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called Crystal malt.

fermentables.name: Caraaroma
fermentables.notes: Very dark crystal malt - similar to a crystal 120 or Caramunich 120 malt. Adds strong caramel flavor, red color, and malty aroma.

fermentables.name: Carafa I
fermentables.notes: Used to intensify aroma and color in dark, Munich beers and stouts.

fermentables.name: Carafa II
fermentables.notes: Used to intensify aroma and color in dark, Munich beers and stouts.

fermentables.name: Carafa III
fermentables.notes: Dark color and aroma - used in some German beers

fermentables.name: Carafoam
fermentables.notes: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer. Also sold under the names Dextrine and Cara-Pils (TM)

fermentables.name: Caramel Wheat Malt
fermentables.notes: Caramel wheat malt - emphasizes wheat malt aroma and adds color to the beer. Popular for Dunkelweizens. Also known as Carawheat.

fermentables.name: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 10L
fermentables.notes: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called Crystal malt.

fermentables.name: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 20L
fermentables.notes: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called Crystal malt.

fermentables.name: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 60L
fermentables.notes: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called Crystal malt.

fermentables.name: Chocolate Malt
fermentables.notes: Dark malt that gives a rich red or brown color and nutty flavor. Maintains some malty flavor, not as dark as roasted malt.

fermentables.name: Corn Sugar (Dextrose)
fermentables.notes: Widely used for bottling at rate of approx 2/3 cup per 5 gallons of beer

fermentables.name: Extra Light Dry Extract
fermentables.notes: Very light color dry malt extract for general purpose use. Use as base or to increase gravity of any ale or lager.

fermentables.name: Honey
fermentables.notes: Can be used to lighten flavor and body when substituted for malt. Limit to 30% as adjunct. Pasturize and add to primary.

fermentables.name: Munich Malt
fermentables.notes: Malty-sweet flavor characteristic and adds a reddish amber color to the beer. Use for: Bock, Porter, Marzen, Oktoberfest beers

fermentables.name: Roasted Barley
fermentables.notes: Roasted at high temperature to create a burnt, grainy, coffee like flavor. Imparts a red to deep brown color.

fermentables.name: Vienna Malt
fermentables.notes: Kiln dried malt darker than Pale Malt, but not as dark as Munich Malt. Imparts a golden to orange color to the beer.

fermentables.name: White Wheat Malt
fermentables.notes: White wheat gives a malty flavor not available from raw wheat. Used in Weiss, Wit and White beers

fermentables.name: Maltodextrin
fermentables.notes: Used to add mouthfeel to a beer. It is marked as non-fermentable as it is usually 97% unfermentable sugars.
